article_node.title: Indonesian Markets Tumble Amid Protests, Looting
article_node.summary: Indonesia’s widespread protests over rising living costs have shaken investor sentiment, dragging stocks and prompting central‑bank intervention, while Thai markets also feel pressure from political turbulence. In Asia, Alibaba’s AI‑driven revenue surge has spurred a rally in Chinese tech stocks, and China’s President Xi called for cooperation at the SCO summit, with India‑China ties seeing a tentative reset as flights resume and trade talks resume. These developments underscore heightened geopolitical risk in Southeast Asia and shifting dynamics in China‑India relations, impacting regional equity, FX, and commodity markets.
